result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel R Cannizzo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 125 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Roundy's ($479.85); on case 15CM1623 ($711.75); on case 15CM1662 ($185.54) to be paid as a condition of probation on this case. To be paid before costs and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.

No Contact with any stores listed in criminal complaints for cases 15CF946, 15CM1622 and 15CM1623. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. LAST 60 days are STAYED for use by agent with court's permission.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 275 days were granted.
05/10/2017 COURT WILL DEFER TO THE DOC CALCULATION OF CREDIT AND THEREFORE CHANGE THE CREDIT DAYS FROM 275 TO 278.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs previously imposed are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Restitution previously imposed are to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Letter from Atty Menden advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Dated 04/25/17, from the DOC to Judge Carter, requesting that the Court review the sentence credit granted during the sentencing after revocation.

05/09/17,  per Judge Carter: I will defer to the DOC calculation of credit and therefore request an amended JOC changing the credit days from 275 to 278.

Defendant Daniel R Cannizzo in court, in custody, with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin, supervised by Assistant District Attorney Abby Nickolie.  Case called for sentencing hearing on revocation.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Menden make statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:    IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3  YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 275 days)
  -   1 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -   2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

COURT ORDERS ANY PREVIOUS COURT COSTS/RESTITUTION PREVIOUSLY ORDERED ARE DUE AS A CONDITION OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION 

DEFENDANT TO BE RETURNED FORTHWITH
AMENDED. Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from the Washington County Jail. (DA's office received a phone call from HOC advising that the Defendant had been transferred)

from Milwaukee House of Corrections

Attorney Eryn M Menden in court.   Defendant Daniel R Cannizzo did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in custody at Milwaukee House of Corrections.  Defendant was not produced.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Milwaukee House of Corrections.  Court reschedules.   Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for March 10, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Menden.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 25, 2017 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Daniel R Cannizzo
Current: 8885 South 68th Street, C/O Milwaukee House of Correction, Franklin, WI 53132 United States  (Effective: 12-14-2016)

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daniel R Cannizzo in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court performs plea colloquy and finds defendant guilty of count #. Cases #15CM1622 and 15CM1623 are dismissed and read in. State gives sentencing recommendations. Atty Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes Statements. The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT#1:

WITHHELD SENTENCE:   


TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any stores listed in the Criminal Complaint on 15CF946, 15CM1622, and 15CM1623, 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously donee
____125 days credit against any sentence imposed

RESTITUTION:  $479.85 to be paid to Roundy's (on 15CM1623), $711.75 + $185.54 to be paid to Roundy's (on 15CM1622) (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation) + $250.00 DNA surcharge.

CONDITION TIME: 90 days-straight time, Last 60 days STAYED for use of agent with court permission. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 11-25-2015 10:45 am

Defendant Daniel R Cannizzo in court, in custody, with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Weathers requests modification of bail on all cases. State objects to any modification of bail. Court denies request to modify bail on all cases. Atty Weathers requests a plea/sentencing date. Court adjourns. Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 10:45 am.
